claim: Flublok (quadrivalent) was evaluated in the pivotal trial against Fluarix (quadrivalent standard-dose vaccine).
explanation: A flowchart outlining pediatric influenza vaccination dosing for the 2022–23 season. The top box asks if the child received ≥2 doses of trivalent or quadrivalent influenza vaccine before July 1, 2022. If yes, the next step is 1 dose of 2022–23 vaccine; if no or unknown, the next step is 2 doses of 2022–23 vaccine administered ≥4 weeks apart. does not support the claim because the image provides a general dosing algorithm for children’s influenza vaccination and does not mention Flublok or any pivotal trial comparing Flublok (quadrivalent) against Fluarix.

The top box asks if the child received ≥2 doses of trivalent or quadrivalent influenza vaccine before July 1, 2022. If yes, the next step is 1 dose of 2022–23 vaccine; if no or unknown, the next step is 2 doses of 2022–23 vaccine administered ≥4 weeks apart.
